turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: My dad's in the other room.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'll only stay a sec.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Close call.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It just occurred to me that I've never snuck through your bedroom window.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Now that it's out of your system.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: And I was home, bored, watching television, THE EXORCIST was on and it got me thinking of you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh it did?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah, it was edited for TV. All the good stuff was cut out and I started thinking about us and how two years ago, we started off kinda hot and heavy, a nice solid "R" rating on our way to an NC17. And how things have changed and, lately, we're just sot of... edited for television.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So you thought you could sneak in my window and we would have a little bump-bump.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: No, no. I wouldn't dream of breaking your underwear rule. I just thought we might do some on top of the clothes stuff.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You know what my dad will do to you?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm going... I'm going.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Would you settle for a PG-13 relationship?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh Billy... Please... God...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I heard screaming. The door was locked. Are you okay...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He's here. He's trying to kill me...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Jesus, SHIT!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Hey, hey, it's just me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No... I don't... it's just... Oh God, Billy, someone was there, someone tried to kill me.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: The police say I scared him off. It wasn't me, Sid.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I know. He called again last night at Tatum's house.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: See, it couldn't have been me. I was in jail, remember?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm so sorry... please understand.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Understand what? That I got a girlfriend who would rather accuse me of being a psychopathic killer than touch me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You know that's not true.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Then what is it? Is there somebody else?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Is it the sex thing? Am I being too pushy?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, it's me, Billy. I need time. I'm still adjusting to my mom.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's been a year since she died.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Tomorrow. One year tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: When are you gonna let that go, Sid? When my mom left my dad -- I just accepted it. This is the way it is. She's not coming back.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Your parents split up. It's not the same thing. Your mom left town, she's not in a coffin somewhere.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You have to move on, Sid.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Subtlety, Stu. Look it up.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's okay. We need to talk.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: So... I'm sorry. I've been a selfish shit and I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, Billy. I'm the one who's been selfish and self-absorbed with all of my post traumatic stress.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You lost your mom...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But you're right -- enough is enough. I can't wallow in the grief process forever and I can't keep lying to myself about who my mom was.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I think in some weird analytical, psychological bullshit way I'm scared I'm gonna turn out just like her, you know? Like the bad seed or something...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Oh Sidney...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Everytime I get close to you I see my mom. I know it doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sure it does. It's like Jodie Foster in SILENCE OF THE LAMBS when she kept having flashbacks of her dead father.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But this is life. This isn't a movie.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sure it is, Sid. It's all a movie. Life's one great big movie. Only you can't pick your genre.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I wanna let go. I do...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Ssshh... everything's gonna be okay. I promise.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sshh... it's okay.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Or even a good porno.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You heard me.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Are you serious?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah... I think so.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Who did you call?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: When you're arrested -- you're allowed one phone call? Who did you call?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I called my dad.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, Sheriff Burke called your dad. I saw him.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah... and when I called no one answered.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You don't still think it was me?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, but if it were you, that would have been a very clever way to throw me off track. Using your one phone call to call me so I wouldn't think it was you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I thought you were...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm alright. Gotta... get... help.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: NO! Don't believe him.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's okay. Give me the gun.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's called GUESS HOW I'M GOING TO DIE!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We already played that game. You lost, remember?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why did you kill my mother?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Why? WHY? Did you hear that, Stu? I think she wants a motive. Hmmm... I don't really believe in motives, Sid. I mean, did Norman Bates have a motive?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I don't understand...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We did your mom a favor, Sid. The woman was a slut bag whore who flashed her shit all over town like she was Sharon Stone or something.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Jesus... fuck, that hurt.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Stop it!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Got the ending figured out yet? Time's running out.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Are you alone in the house?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You bitch -- where the fuck are you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Not so fast. We're gonna play a little game. It's called GUESS WHO JUST CALLED THE POLICE AND REPORTED YOUR SORRY MOTHERFUCKING ASS?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm gonna rip you up bitch. Just like your slut whore mother.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Gotta find me first, you pansy-assed Mama's boy.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Who are you trying to reach?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What number is this?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: What number are you trying to reach?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I think you have the wrong number.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Do I?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: It happens. Take it easy.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm sorry. I guess I dialed the wrong number.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: So why did you dial it again?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: To apologize.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: You're forgiven. Bye now.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Wait, wait, don't hang up.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I want to talk to you for a second.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: They've got 900 numbers for that. Seeya.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Why don't you want to talk to me?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You tell me your name, I'll tell you mine.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What's that noise?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Popcorn.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You're making popcorn?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I only eat popcorn at the movies.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I'm getting ready to watch a video.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Really? What?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Just some scary movie.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Do you like scary movies?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What's your favorite scary movie?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You have to have a favorite.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Uh... HALLOWEEN. You know, the one with the guy with the white mask who just sorta walks around and stalks the baby sitters. What's yours?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Guess.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Uh... NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Is that the one where the guy had knives for fingers?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Yeah... Freddy Krueger.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Freddy -- that's right. I liked that movie. It was scary.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: The first one was, but the rest sucked.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: So, you gotta boyfriend?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Why? You wanna ask me out?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Maybe. Do you have a boyfriend?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You never told me your name.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Why do you want to know my name?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Because I want to know who I'm looking at.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I want to now who I'm talking to.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: That's not what you said.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What do you think I said?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I have to go now.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Wait... I thought we were gonna go out.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Nah, I don't think so...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Don't hang up on me.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Gotta go.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Don't...

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I told you not to hang up on me.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: To talk.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Dial someone else, okay?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You getting scared?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: No-bored.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Listen, asshole...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: NO, YOU LISTEN, YOU LITTLE BITCH. IF YOU HANG UP ON ME AGAIN I'LL GUT YOU LIKE A FISH. UNDERSTAND?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Is this some kind of a joke?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: More of a game, really.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I'm two seconds from calling the police.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: They'd never make it in time.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: TO SEE WHAT YOUR INSIDES LOOK LIKE.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Look, enough is enough. You had your fun now you better leave me alone or else.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Or else what?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: My boyfriend will be here any second and he'll be pissed when I tell him...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I thought you didn't have a boyfriend.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I lied. I do have a boyfriend and he'll be here any second and your ass better be gone.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I swear it. And he's big and plays football and will beat the shit out of you.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm getting scared.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I'm telling you the truth. I lied before...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I believe you...

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: So you better leave.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: His name wouldn't be Steve, would it?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: How do you know his name?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Go to the back door and turn on the porch light -- again.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Guess.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Please don't hurt him.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: That all depends on you.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I wanna play a game.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Then he dies. Right now.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: NOOO!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Which is it?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: What kind of game?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Turn off the light.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Please don't do this...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Come on. It'll be fun.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: No... please.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: It's an easy category. Movie trivia.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: ...please...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'll even give you a warm up question.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Don't do this. I can't...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Name the killer in HALLOWEEN.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Come on. It's you favorite scary movie, remember? He had a white mask, he stalked the baby-sitters.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Come on, yes you do.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Please..stop...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What's his name?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I can't think.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Michael... Michael Myers.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: YES!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Now for the real question.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: NOOOO....

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: But you're doing so well.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Please go away! Leave us alone!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Then answer the question. Same category.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: ...please... no...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Name the killer in FRIDAY THE 13TH.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm sorry. That's the wrong answer.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: No it's not. It was Jason.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Afraid not.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: It was Jason. I saw that goddamned movie twenty times. It was Jason.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Then you should know Jason's MOTHER -- Mrs. Vorhees was the original killer. Jason didn't show up until the sequel.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: You tricked me...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Lucky, for you there's a bonus round. But poor Steve... I'm afraid... he's out.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: ...leave me alone... please...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Answer the question and I will.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What door am I at?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: There are two doors to your house. A front door and a back one. If you answer correctly -- you live.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Don't make me... I can't... I won't.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Your call.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Hi! Gale Weathers. Field Correspondent, INSIDE STORY.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I know who you are, ma'am. How's the eye?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Productive. So they're closing down the school?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Well... uh... yes ma'am. For the time being.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And why is that? Has something happened?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You're not supposed to be here, ma'am.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I know, I should be in New York covering the Sharon Stone stalker but who knew? Please, call me Gale. You look awfully young to be a police officer.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I'm twenty-five years old, ma'am.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Twenty-five, huh? In a demographic study I proved to be most popular amongst males, 11-24. I just missed you. Of course, you don't look a day over twelve, except in the upper torso area. Does the force require that you work out?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Boy, you people sure do make fuss over a serial killer.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Serial killer is not really accurate, ma'am. The killer has yet to strike twice.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well, we can hope, can't we? We certainly don't have any leads. A ghost mask, a cellular phone -- not much there.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: We're tracking the cellular phone bill.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Really? You small town guys are good. And have you located Sidney's father?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: No, not yet.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: He's not a suspect, is he?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: We haven't ruled out that possibil...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: If you'll excuse me, ma'am.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Am I keeping you? I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: That's quite alright. If I may say so, ma'am, you're much prettier in person.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I just turned 25. I was 24 for a whole year.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You are precious. Please, call me Gale.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Evening, ma'am.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Deputy... good evening.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What brings you out to these parts?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You never know when or where a story will break.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Not much story here. Just a bunch of kids cutting loose.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Then what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Keeping an eye on things. Checking the place out.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Mind if I join you?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Sheriff just radioed me. I'm gonna check out a possible lead. Thought you might like to join me.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What kind of lead?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: A car was spotted in the bushes a little ways up the road.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'd love to. If you're sure it's alright?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Ma'am, I am the Deputy of this town.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Can I bring Kenny?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: NO! I mean... I should probably take just you.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: So is Dewey your real name?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Dwight. Dewey was something I got stuck with a long time ago.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I like it. It's... sexy.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Nah... it's just this town's way of not taking me serious.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What about Gale Weathers? I sound like a meteorologist...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: People treat me like the Antichrist of television journalism.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I don't think you're so bad.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Shit. It's Neil Prescott's car.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Sidney's father?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: We gotta get back. Jesus. He's here. What the fuck is he doing here?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I'll call for backup.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'll get my camera.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Oh, God, Sid, I'm sorry I was late.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You can't be here, Tatum. This is an official crime scene.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Does mom know?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Yes, you doofus.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Hey... Dewey. Can we go now?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Hold up a sec...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What did Mama tell you? When I wear this badge you treat me like a man of the law.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: I'm sorry, Deputy Dewey-boy but we're ready to go.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: A party? Mom's gonna kill you. Then me.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Don't be so self-righteous. It's just a little blow out -- we'll be perfectly safe.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: No, Dewey. You'll ruin the whole night.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Sorry, police orders. I'll stay out of the way, I promise.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: What is she doing here?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: She's with me. I just wanted to check on things.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You gonna be able to come down to the station and talk to us a bit?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: ...yeah...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Did you reach my Dad?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You're sure it was the Hilton?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: At the airport.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: He's not registered. Could he have gone to another hotel?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I don't know. I guess.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: We'll find him, Sid. Don't worry.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Any word on my Dad?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Not yet, but we're looking. If you need anything...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Billy was released. His cellular bill was clean. He didn't make those calls.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Somebody called me, Dewey. I'm not making it up.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I know. We're checking every cellular account in the county. Any calls made to you or Casey Becker are being cross-referenced. It's gonna take time but we'll find him.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And my Dad? Any word on him?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: God, look at this place, it's THE TOWN THAT DREADED SUNDOWN.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Hey, I saw that movie. True story, 'bout some killer in Texas.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I see you as a young Meg Ryan myself.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Thanks, Dewey. But with my luck they'd cast Tori Spelling.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You girls ready.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Looks like I'm your personal bodyguard tonight, Sid.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Have they found my father?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Afraid not.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Should I be worried?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: It's Deputy Riley today, Sid.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: How is everything?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: We got him, Sheriff. Billy Loomis.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Hank Loomis' kid? Aw... Jesus...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: He's her boyfriend.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I was first to respond.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: What were you doing out here?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Drive by patrol.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: How is she?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: She's tough.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Have to be. The shit she's gone through.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: That ghost mask is sold at both Kroger's and WalMart. Neither of which keep purchase records.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: What about the cellular phone bill?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: They're pulling Loomis' account. But it'll be morning before we see something. You think he did it?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Twenty years ago I woulda said not a chance. But these kids today... damn if I know.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: She staying with you?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: We haven't located her Dad yet.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: She's okay. Looks like some boys were teasing her. Himbry's shutting down the school though. I want you to take look around.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Yes, sir, sheriff.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Dewey! Where the hell you been, boy?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Keeping my eye on Sidney.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Listen up, Dewey, because it's bad. Real bad. Aircomp just faxed us. The calls were listed to Neil Prescott -- Sidney's father. He made the calls with his cellular phone. It's confirmed.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Couldn't his cellular number have been cloned?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: There's more. Guess what tomorrow is? The anniversary of his wife's death. It all fits. He's our man.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Have you contacted the bureau?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: They believe he's out of state by now. We'll keep roadblocks and curfew in effect through the night. If he's not picked up by morning -- we'll do a house to house.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You think he could still be in town?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: He'd have to be crazy. Where's Sidney?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: She's with my sister. Should I bring her in?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Hold off for now. Just stay close to her.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: She'll be with her friends over at Stu Maker's tonight.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF BURKE
turns.text: Watch her. Don't let on -- just keep your eyes out.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: That fish smelled strong.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I told you to send it back.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: What is it? Where's Casey?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Casey? Casey?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Call the police.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Casey? Where are you honey? Call the police, goddamnit.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: The phone's dead.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I can hear her. Oh Mother of God, I can hear her.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Casey! Casey!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Not my daughter... not my...

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: What? What?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Jesus! The camera-hurry!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Jesus Christ! An innocent man on death row. A killer still on the loose. Kenny, tell me I'm dreaming.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: You want to go live?
